abstract: The move ends a four-year odyssey that put the affordable middle-class enclave at the center of both the biggest real estate deal in history and a major financial debacle.
snippet: The move ends a four-year odyssey that put the affordable middle-class enclave at the center of both the biggest real estate deal in history and a major financial debacle.
lead_paragraph: Lenders formally took control of Stuyvesant Town and Peter Cooper Village on Tuesday, ending a four-year odyssey that put the affordable middle-class enclave at the center of both the biggest real estate deal in history and a major financial debacle, The New York Times’s Charles V. Bagli reports.

headline.main: Stuyvesant Town’s Lenders Take Over Property
